head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Teacher Accused Of Sexual Assault

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Teacher Accused Of Sexual Assault

body.head.byline: By William K. Rashbaum (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Police arrest Manhattan junior high school teacher Jose Segarra on charges of sexually abusing 13-year-old boy (S)

block.p: A junior high school teacher was arrested yesterday on charges that he forced a 13-year-old boy to perform a sex act in a closet at the school, the police said. Jose Segarra, 42, who told the police he had been a teacher for 22 years, was charged with first-degree sodomy and first-degree sexual abuse, said Lt. Christopher Stahly, the commanding officer of the Manhattan Special Victims Squad. The police said Mr. Segarra had sexually abused and sodomized the boy, a student, about 10 a.m. on Monday inside the school, Junior High School 117 on East 109th Street, and on two other occasions in the last two weeks. Mr. Segarra was arrested at the school, where he had taught since 1996.
